description: Also known as the Tanimbar Corella, this is one of the smallest white cockatoo species. They have a small crest and a pale pink patch between the eyes.
temperament: Extremely intelligent, playful, and highly inquisitive. They are known for being masters of escape and problem-solving. Can be very affectionate but also very demanding and nippy.
loudness: Very Loud. Despite their small size, they can produce an incredibly loud, piercing screech.
vocalization: Can learn to talk, but they are more known for their loud calls and ability to mimic sounds.
dietaryNeeds: A high-quality pelleted diet with a variety of fresh vegetables. They are energetic and need a good diet, but watch for weight gain.
healthPointers: Can live up to 40 years. Very prone to feather plucking and self-mutilation if they become bored or stressed. PBFD is also a major concern.
housing: Not recommended for apartments. They need an exceptionally secure and durable cage with complex locks. Minimum size: 30"W x 22"D x 40"H.
